question.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding sexual reproduction?

options.text: Off springs are not identical to the parents but identical among themselves.
Off springs are identical to the parents but not identical among themselves
Off springs are identical to the parents and identical among themselves
Off springs are not identical to the parents or among themselves

solution.text: Organism exhibiting sexual reproduction exhibits male and female gamete formation either in a single individual or in two different individuals of the opposite sex. Fertilization is the process of fusion of male and female gamete that results in the formation of a zygote. Since sexual reproduction takes place by fusion of male and female gamete, the resulting offsprings produced are non identical to the parents as well as amongst themselves.
